title: Personal Website
header: A virtual presentation of myself; what you're seeing right now!
story: Yeah, I'm pretty sure I know how to use semicolons. This was a very fun project for me. It took me about 3 days to get through TheNetNinja's ReactJS tutorials and then essentially forever to get this website up and going. If I have any regrets in life, that would be having a preference in improvising over planning. Oh my god I am 100% going to recode this from ground up when I have the time to do so. With that being said, my suggestion to you, dear reader, is to NOT checkout the CSS in the GitHub and intentinally resize this window :)
desc: Learned ReactJS and CSS in a short time frame (1 week!) to develop a personal website
Experimented with Figma and learned how to mockup websites
Learned how to set and achieve goals to ensure this personal project is on track to completion
Practiced and studied modern design trends to implement on personal website (:p)
Perfected the art of Ctrl+C and Ctrl+V

title: HealthChain
story: It was all one day when some friends of mine asked me to sign up with them for a hackathon hosted at their university. I was like 'why the heck not'! After all, this seems like it'd be a good time to see how good my coding skills are (spoiler alert: I was humbled much).
desc: DeltaHacks IX winner for "Most Creative Use of Verbwire API"

title: Rrythm Music Bot
header: A bot coded in NodeJS using discord.js and play-dl
